metaTitle: €585k Luxury 3-Bed Villa la Nucia - Costa Blanca
metaDescription: Exclusif 3-bedroom villa in la Nucia, Alicante. €585,000. Premium specification, 40% less than Spanish islands. Prestigious Costa Blanca location.
heroIntro:
Discover an exceptional opportunity to acquire a sophisticated 3-bedroom villa in the prestigious Escandinavia neighbourhood of la Nucia, Alicante. This premium property, priced at €585,000, represents distinguished value for discerning buyers seeking exclusive coastal living. With a built area of 125m² thoughtfully designed across a 297m² plot, this residence exemplifies contemporary Mediterranean sophistication.

What sets this property apart is its premium specification and strategic positioning within one of Costa Blanca's most sought-after residential enclaves. At €4,680 per m², this villa commands exceptional value—40% less than comparable properties in Spanish island markets—while maintaining the quality standards expected by luxury buyers. The established community in la Nucia attracts international professionals and sophisticated purchasers who appreciate understated elegance and proximity to cultural, sporting, and leisure amenities.

This investment combines rental potential, capital appreciation (the market has grown 8% year-on-year), and the lifestyle benefits of Costa Blanca's Mediterranean climate. Whether as a personal residence, holiday retreat, or investment property, this villa in la Nucia offers the exclusivity and prestige discerning buyers demand.
areaSection: La Nucia is a prestigious hilltop municipality within the Marina Baja region of Alicante, characterised by its elevated position offering panoramic perspectives across the Mediterranean landscape. The town maintains a distinctly cosmopolitan character while preserving authentic Mediterranean charm, creating an ideal environment for those seeking balance between sophistication and accessibility. The climate is exceptional year-round, with approximately 300 days of sunshine, mild winters, and warm summers tempered by coastal breezes. La Nucia's strategic location provides immediate access to the Blue Flag beaches of the Benidorm coast whilst remaining sufficiently removed to ensure tranquillity and privacy. The municipality has developed purposefully as a residential destination for international buyers, with carefully maintained infrastructure and comprehensive amenities. The elevated terrain naturally provides excellent drainage and ventilation, contributing to the area's appeal for health-conscious residents.
lifestyleSection: Life in la Nucia exemplifies Mediterranean living refined for contemporary tastes. The established expatriate community—predominantly British, German, and Scandinavian—has cultivated an environment where English is widely spoken, yet authentic Spanish culture remains accessible. Daily routines include morning coffee at local cafés, shopping at well-stocked supermarkets including Mercadona and Consum, or exploring the weekly markets that showcase regional produce. Healthcare facilities are comprehensive, with private English-speaking clinics and the regional hospital accessible within 30 minutes. The culinary scene balances international restaurants catering to diverse palates with traditional Spanish establishments. Recreational pursuits are abundant: championship golf courses, multiple Blue Flag beaches within 20 minutes' drive, and a calendar of cultural events reflecting the international community's sophistication. For those prioritising accessibility, essential services—banks, pharmacies, international schools—are efficiently distributed throughout the municipality.
investmentSection: This property presents compelling investment characteristics for discerning buyers. The Costa Blanca market has demonstrated 8% year-on-year appreciation, with la Nucia commanding premium valuations due to its established international community and infrastructure quality. Rental potential is substantial—comparable 3-bedroom villas in this location achieve approximately €800 per week during peak season, generating annual returns of €30,000-€35,000 with proper management. The property's €4,680/m² valuation is strategically positioned: approximately 112% above la Nucia's average of €2,200/m², reflecting premium specification and location, yet 40% below equivalent Spanish island properties. This positioning offers both capital appreciation potential and rental yield opportunity. The established expatriate community ensures consistent rental demand from international travellers seeking residential experiences rather than hotel accommodation. Long-term ownership benefits from Costa Blanca's demographic trends: continued migration of EU retirees and professionals seeking Mediterranean lifestyles.
conclusion: This exceptional villa in la Nucia represents a refined opportunity for discerning international buyers seeking sophisticated Mediterranean living with documented investment potential. The combination of premium specification, strategic valuation, established expatriate community, and comprehensive amenities creates a compelling proposition for those valuing both lifestyle quality and financial prudence. The property's position within one of Costa Blanca's most prestigious residential enclaves, coupled with accessible beaches, championship golf courses, and reliable healthcare facilities, supports both personal enjoyment and rental income generation. Whether acquiring a permanent residence, seasonal retreat, or investment asset, this villa delivers the exclusivity and prestige international buyers expect. Contact our sales team via WhatsApp to arrange a private viewing and discuss acquisition options tailored to your specific requirements. Your Costa Blanca lifestyle awaits.

faqs.question: La Costa Blanca est-elle un bon endroit pour acheter un bien immobilier ?
faqs.answer: Yes. Costa Blanca consistently demonstrates positive investment characteristics, with 8% year-on-year market appreciation. The region attracts substantial international buyer demand, particularly from Northern European retirees and professionals seeking Mediterranean lifestyles. Established expatriate communities, comprehensive amenities, and reliable rental markets make it particularly attractive for investment-focused buyers. La Nucia specifically appeals to sophisticated purchasers valuing community infrastructure and privacy.

faqs.question: Les étrangers peuvent-ils acheter un bien immobilier en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign nationals can purchase property in Spain without significant restrictions. EU citizens face minimal bureaucratic requirements, whilst non-EU purchasers must obtain a foreigner identification number (NIE) and complete standard purchase procedures. Spanish law treats foreign and domestic buyers equivalently regarding property rights and ownership protections. Professional legal guidance ensures compliance with applicable regulations and optimises tax structures.

faqs.question: Quels sont les frais d'achat d'un bien immobilier en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Purchase costs typically total 8-10% of the property price, including: transfer tax (6-8% depending on regional location), notary fees (approximately 1%), property registration costs (0.5-1%), and legal/administrative fees. For a €585,000 property, expect approximately €46,800-€58,500 in additional acquisition costs. These figures vary slightly by autonomous community; Alicante province maintains favourable tax structures compared to other regions.

faqs.question: Quel est le coût de la vie sur la Costa Blanca ?
faqs.answer: Cost of living in la Nucia and surrounding Costa Blanca areas is moderate compared to Northern European capitals. Monthly expenses for a retired couple typically range €1,200-€1,800, including utilities, groceries, and entertainment. Healthcare costs are minimal for residents with Spanish public insurance or private supplementary coverage. Restaurant dining, entertainment, and leisure activities offer excellent value. Retirees particularly appreciate the economical lifestyle relative to their home countries.

faqs.question: La Costa Blanca est-elle adaptée aux retraités ?
faqs.answer: Excellent. Costa Blanca attracts thousands of international retirees annually, particularly from UK, Germany, and Scandinavia. The region offers year-round pleasant climate, comprehensive healthcare facilities, affordable living costs, and established expatriate communities providing social integration. La Nucia specifically appeals to retirees seeking quieter residential environments whilst maintaining proximity to beaches, entertainment, and international services. Many retirees report substantial lifestyle improvements compared to northern climates.

faqs.question: À quelle distance se trouve la Costa Blanca de la France ?
faqs.answer: Approximately 1,300 km. Alicante-Elche Airport, 40 minutes from la Nucia, offers direct flights to London and regional UK airports, typically requiring 2.5-3 hours flight time. Budget carriers provide competitive pricing enabling regular UK visits. Many residents maintain frequent family connections through accessible air connectivity, making seasonal visits feasible and affordable.

faqs.question: Quel temps fait-il sur la Costa Blanca ?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys Mediterranean climate with approximately 300 annual sunshine days. Summers (June-September) reach 28-32°C with low rainfall, whilst winters remain mild at 10-15°C with occasional precipitation. Spring and autumn provide ideal temperatures of 18-25°C. The climate supports year-round outdoor activities and explains the region's popularity with international residents seeking reliable pleasant weather compared to northern European alternatives.

faqs.question: Puis-je obtenir un prêt hypothécaire en Espagne en tant qu'étranger ?
faqs.answer: Yes. Major Spanish banks offer mortgages to foreign nationals, typically providing 60-80% loan-to-value ratios at competitive interest rates. EU citizens access mortgages most readily; non-EU purchasers may require additional documentation but are generally accommodated. Current rates are favourable compared to historical levels. Professional mortgage brokers specialising in international buyer financing facilitate efficient approval processes and optimise loan structures for tax efficiency.

Off-season rates remain attractive at €400-€600 weekly. The established international community seeking residential holiday experiences ensures consistent demand.
